sen.j: 今川 貞世（いまがわ さだよ）は、鎌倉時代後期から南北朝時代 (日本)・室町時代の武将、遠江国の守護大名、室町幕府の九州探題。
sen.e: Sadayo IMAGAWA was a busho (Japanese military commander), shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) in Totomi Province, Kyushu Tandai (local commissioner) of Muromachi bakufu in Muromachi Period, lived from the late Kamakura Period, the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), until Muromachi Period.

Sadayo IMAGAWA was a busho (Japanese military commander), shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) in Totomi Province, Kyushu Tandai (local commissioner) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), lived from the late Kamakura period, the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), until the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: Muromachi bakufu in Muromachi Period→the Muromachi bakufuとし、bakufuの補足追加、the kamakura period、the Mueomachi periodに修正しました。
sen.e: Sadayo IMAGAWA was a busho (Japanese military commander), shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords) in Totomi Province, Kyushu Tandai (local commissioner) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), lived from the late Kamakura period, the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), until the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 歌人としても名高い。
sen.e: He was also known as a kajin (waka poet).
He was also known as a waka (a 31-syllable Japanese poem) poet.
sen.cmt: a kajin (waka poet)→a waka poetとし、wakaの補足を追加しました。（参照: 新和英中辞典)
sen.e: He was also known as a waka (a 31-syllable Japanese poem) poet.

sen.j: 法名は了俊（りょうしゅん）で、今川了俊と呼ばれることも多い。
sen.e: His homyo (a Buddhist name given to a person who has died or has entered the priesthood) was Ryoshun and he was often called Ryosyun IMAGAWA.
His homyo (a Buddhist name given to a person who has died or has entered the priesthood) was Ryoshun and he was often called Ryoshun IMAGAWA.
His homyo (a Buddhist name given to a person who has died or has entered the priesthood) was Ryoshun and he was often called Ryoshun IMAGAWA.

sen.j: 没年は異説あり。
sen.e: There are different opinions about his age at death.
There are different opinions about his age at death.
There are different opinions about his age at death.

sen.j: 幼少時は不明だが、父に従っていた記録は残り、12,3歳頃から和歌を学ぶ。
sen.e: There is no record about his childhood but there is a record shows that he followed his father and was lectured Waka by father when he was 1to 3 year old.
There is no record about his childhood but there is a record showing that he followed his father and was lectured waka when he was one to three year old.
sen.cmt: there is a record shows that→there is a record showing thatに修正、表記統一のためWaka→wakaとし、by fatherを削除、数字をスペルアウト、スペース追加しました。
sen.e: There is no record about his childhood but there is a record showing that he followed his father and was lectured waka when he was one to three year old.

sen.j: 足利家内部の対立から征夷大将軍の足利尊氏と弟の足利直義の両派の抗争へ発展した観応の擾乱においては、父とともに将軍側に属する。
sen.e: At Kanno disturbance which was developed from internal conflict of the Ashikaga family to fight between Takauji ASHIKAGA, Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") and Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA, a younger brother of Takauji, Sadayo and his father joined to the Shogun group.

At the Kanno Disturbance which was developed from internal conflict of the Ashikaga family to fight between Takauji ASHIKAGA, Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") and Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA, a younger brother of Takauji, Sadayo and his father joined to the Shogun group.

At the Kanno Disturbance which was developed from internal conflict of the Ashikaga family to fight between Takauji ASHIKAGA, Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") and Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA, a younger brother of Takauji, Sadayo and his father joined to the Shogun group.

sen.j: 直義派や南朝 (日本)勢力と戦い、55年には細川清氏とともに東寺合戦で戦う。
sen.e: They fought against Tadayoshi group and the Southern Court (Japan) and fought against Kiyouji HOSOKAWA at the To-ji Temple battle in 1355.
They fought against Tadayoshi group and the Southern Court (Japan) and fought against Kiyouji HOSOKAWA at the battle of To-ji Temple in 1355.
sen.cmt: the Toji-Temple battle→the battle of To-ji Templeとしました。
sen.e: They fought against Tadayoshi group and the Southern Court (Japan) and fought against Kiyouji HOSOKAWA at the battle of To-ji Temple in 1355.

sen.j: 幕府執事となった清氏が61年に失脚して南朝に下ると、父の命で講和呼びかけのために遠江から召還される。
sen.e: When Kiyouji who was once the steward of the bakufu fell from power in 1361 and joined the Southern Court, Sadayo was ordered by his father and came from Totomi Province to call for pacification.
When Kiyouji who was once the steward of the bakufu fell from power in 1361 and joined the Southern Court, Sadayo was ordered by his father and came from Totomi Province to call for pacification.
When Kiyouji who was once the steward of the bakufu fell from power in 1361 and joined the Southern Court, Sadayo was ordered by his father and came from Totomi Province to call for pacification.

sen.j: 軍事活動のほか、遠江国や山城国の守護職、幕府の引付頭人などを務め、67年に2代将軍の足利義詮が死去すると出家。
sen.e: Other than military activities, he served as Shugoshiki (provincial constables) in Totomi Province or Yamashiro Province and Hikitsuke tonin (chairman of the court of justice), after Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA died in1367, he entered priesthood.

Other than military activities, he served as Shugoshiki (provincial constables) in Totomi Province or Yamashiro Province and Hikitsuke tonin (chairman of the court of justice); after the second Shogun Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA died in 1367, he entered priesthood.
sen.cmt: 「2代将軍の」→訳漏れのため訳出、カンマ→セミコロンに変更しました。
sen.e: Other than military activities, he served as Shugoshiki (provincial constables) in Totomi Province or Yamashiro Province and Hikitsuke tonin (chairman of the court of justice); after the second Shogun Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA died in 1367, he entered priesthood.

sen.j: 3代将軍足利義満時代の1370年（建徳元年/応安3年）頃に、管領の細川頼之から渋川義行の後任の九州探題に推薦され、正式に任命された。
sen.e: In 1370, the period of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third Shogun, Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, Kanrei (shogunal deputy) recommended Ryoshun as Kyushu Tandai replacement for Yoshiyuki SHIBIKAWA and was officially assigned.
sen.cmt: 以後今川貞世出家後の時期に関する記述であるため、Ryoshunを使用します。
sen.e: In 1370, the period of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third Shogun, Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, Kanrei (shogunal deputy) recommended Ryoshun as Kyushu Tandai replacement for Yoshiyuki SHIBUKAWA and was officially assigned.

In 1370, the period of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third Shogun, Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA, Kanrei (shogunal deputy) recommended Ryoshun as Kyushu Tandai replacement for Yoshiyuki SHIBUKAWA and was officially assigned.

sen.j: 観応の擾乱後に南朝方の菊池氏が懐良親王を奉じた征西府、将軍尊氏の庶子である足利直冬などが分立し、征西府が少弐氏を撃破して大宰府を占領。
sen.e: Afterhte Kanno disturbance, Kikuchi clan who committed to the Southern Court helped Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi of Seiseifu fortress and Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA, illegitimate child of Shogun Takauji, acted independent at that time, because Seiseifu fortress destroyed Shoni clan and occupied Dazaifu (local government office in Kyushu region) and the Southern Court gained power, Sadayo was sent to suppress Kyushu region.

After the Kanno Disturbance, the Kikuchi clan who committed to the Southern Court helped Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi of Seiseifu fortress and Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA, illegitimate child of Shogun Takauji, acted independent at that time, because Seiseifu fortress destroyed the Shoni clan and occupied Dazaifu (local government office in the Kyushu region).
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」Afterhte Kanno disturbance→After the Kanno Disturbanceに修正、the Kikuchi clan、the Shoni clan、the Kyushu regionとしました。
sen.e: After the Kanno Disturbance, the Kikuchi clan who committed to the Southern Court helped Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi of Seiseifu fortress and Tadafuyu ASHIKAGA, illegitimate child of Shogun Takauji, acted independent at that time, because Seiseifu fortress destroyed the Shoni clan and occupied Dazaifu (local government office in the Kyushu region).

sen.j: 南朝勢力が強くなっていた九州地方の平定のために派遣される。
sen.e: The Southern Court gained power and Sadayo was sent to suppress the Kyushu region.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」the Kyushu regionとしました。
sen.e: The Southern Court gained power and Sadayo was sent to suppress the Kyushu region.

sen.j: 本国の遠江で準備をした後、10月に京都を出発、中国地方を通過して12月に九州へ至る。
sen.e: After he prepared in Totomi Province, he left Kyoto in October, went through Chugoku region and arrived Kyushu in December.
After he prepared in Totomi Province, he left Kyoto in October, went through the Chugoku region and arrived Kyushu in December.
After he prepared in Totomi Province, he left Kyoto in October, went through the Chugoku region and arrived Kyushu in December.

sen.j: 大内義弘などの協力も得て貞世は新興の国人勢力と連絡し、阿蘇氏の協力を得て豊後の菊池を、松浦党の協力を得て大宰府を攻め、了俊自身の兵は中央から大宰府を攻めた。
sen.e: In cooperation with Yoshihiro OUCHI Ryoshun contacted to Kokujin (local lord), attacked Kikuchi clan in Bungo Province cooperated with Aso clan and attacked Dazaifu cooperated with Matsuura Party and his own army attacked Dazaifu from the center.

In cooperation with Yoshihiro OUCHI Ryoshun contacted to emerging Kokujin (local lord) group, attacked the Kikuchi clan in Bungo Province with the cooperation of the Aso clan and attacked Dazaifu with the cooperation of the Matsuura Party and his own army attacked Dazaifu from the center.
sen.cmt: 「新興の国人勢力」とあるため、Kokujin (local lord)→emerging Kokujin (local lord) groupに修正、cooperated with→with the cooperation of、the Kikuchi clan、the Aso clan、the Matsuura Partyとしました。
sen.e: In cooperation with Yoshihiro OUCHI Ryoshun contacted to emerging Kokujin (local lord) group, attacked the Kikuchi clan in Bungo Province with the cooperation of the Aso clan and attacked Dazaifu with the cooperation of the Matsuura Party and his own army attacked Dazaifu from the center.

sen.j: 1372年（文中元年/応安5年）6月には懐良親王、菊池武光らを筑後高良山(福岡県久留米市)から菊池氏本拠の肥後隈部まで追い、征西府から大宰府を奪回し、拠点とする。
sen.e: In June 1372, he drove Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi and Takemitsu KIKUCHI from Mt. Kora in Chikugo Province (present-day Kurume City, Fukuoka Prefecture) and tracked down them at the headquarter of Kikuchi clan, then he recaptured Dazaifu from Seiseifu fortress and put a foothold there.

In July 1372, he drove Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi and Takemitsu KIKUCHI from Mt. Kora in Chikugo Province (present-day Kurume City, Fukuoka Prefecture) and tracked down them at Kumabe of Higo Province, the headquarter of the Kikuchi clan, then he recaptured Dazaifu from Seiseifu fortress and put a foothold there.
sen.cmt: 旧暦→新暦に修正、「肥後隈部」→訳漏れのため訳出、the Kikuchi clanとしました。
sen.e: In July 1372, he drove Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi and Takemitsu KIKUCHI from Mt. Kora in Chikugo Province (present-day Kurume City, Fukuoka Prefecture) and tracked down them at Kumabe of Higo Province, the headquarter of the Kikuchi clan, then he recaptured Dazaifu from Seiseifu fortress and put a foothold there.

sen.j: 戦局は肥後へ移り、74年7月に了俊は水島まで出兵する。
sen.e: The battle area moved to Higo Province, in 1374 Ryoshun led army to Mizushima district.
The battle area moved to Higo Province, in August 1374 Ryoshun led army to the Mizushima district.
sen.cmt: the Mizushima districtとし、「7月」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。(74年7月→文中3年7月で新暦換算しました)
sen.e: The battle area moved to Higo Province, in August 1374 Ryoshun led army to the Mizushima district.

sen.j: 1375年（天授 (日本)元年/永和 (日本)元年）、水島においては会戦に備えて勢力結集をはかり、九州三人衆と呼ばれる大友親世、少弐冬資、薩摩の島津氏久らの来援を呼びかける。
sen.e: In 1375 he tried to gather more force in Mizushima to prepare a battle and asked Kyushu sanninshu (three major power of Kyushu region) including Chikayo OTOMO, Fuyusuke SHONI, Ujihisa SHIMAZU, to help him.

In 1375 he tried to gather more force in Mizushima to prepare a battle and asked Kyushu sanninshu (three major power of the Kyushu region) including Chikayo OTOMO, Fuyusuke SHONI, Ujihisa SHIMAZU in Satsuma, to help him.
sen.cmt: 「薩摩の」→訳漏れのため訳出、the Kyushu regionとしました。
sen.e: In 1375 he tried to gather more force in Mizushima to prepare a battle and asked Kyushu sanninshu (three major power of the Kyushu region) including Chikayo OTOMO, Fuyusuke SHONI, Ujihisa SHIMAZU in Satsuma, to help him.

sen.j: 三人衆のうち1人、九州探題と対立していた少弐氏の少弐冬資は着陣を拒むが、島津氏久の仲介で来陣する。
sen.e: One of Kyushu sannninshu, Fuyusuke SHONI from Shoni clan refused Ryoshun's proposal because he was opposed to Kyushu Tandai but he was convinced by Ujihisa SHIMAZU and joined Ryoshun.
One of the Kyushu sanninshu, Fuyusuke SHONI from the Shoni clan refused Ryoshun's proposal because he was opposed to Kyushu Tandai but he was convinced by Ujihisa SHIMAZU and joined Ryoshun.
sen.cmt: One of Kyushu sannninshu→One of the Kyushu sanninshuに修正、the Shoni clanとしました。
sen.e: One of the Kyushu sanninshu, Fuyusuke SHONI from the Shoni clan refused Ryoshun's proposal because he was opposed to Kyushu Tandai but he was convinced by Ujihisa SHIMAZU and joined Ryoshun.

sen.j: 水島の陣において了俊は宴の最中に冬資を謀殺、この水島の変により氏久は離反して帰国。
sen.e: At the camp in Mizushima district, Ryoshun murdered Fuyusuke during a feast and because this incident which was called Mizushima no hen, Ujihisa broke away and went home, later Shimazu became a resistance force against Ryoshun's rule in Kyushu.
At the camp in the Mizushima district, Ryoshun murdered Fuyusuke during a feast and because of this incident, which was called the Mizushima Incident, Ujihisa broke away and went home,
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」in the Mizushima districtとし、because this incident→because of this incidentに修正、Mizushima no hen→the Mizushima Incidentとし、カンマ追加しました。
sen.e: At the camp in the Mizushima district, Ryoshun murdered Fuyusuke during a feast and because of this incident, which was called the Mizushima Incident, Ujihisa broke away and went home,

sen.j: 島津氏は了俊の九州経営に抵抗するようになる。
sen.e: Later the Shimazu clan became a resistance force against Ryoshun's rule in Kyushu.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」Shimazu→the Shimazu clanとしました。
sen.e: Later the Shimazu clan became a resistance force against Ryoshun's rule in Kyushu.

sen.j: 貞世は懐良親王を指すとされている「日本国王良懐」を冊封するために派遣された明使を抑留。
sen.e: Ryoshun interned a envoy from Ming who was sent to cofer peerage of "日本国王良懐 (King of Japan Ryokai)" because "King of Japan Ryokai" seemed to be Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi.
sen.cmt: ※ここで原文主語が貞世となっていますが、Ryoshunと訳出しました。 ※「日本国王良懐」は漢字と読み（良懐は「りょうかい」としました）を併記しました。
sen.e: Ryoshun interned an envoy from Ming who was sent to confer peerage of '日本国王良懐' (King of Japan Ryokai); because 'King of Japan Ryokai' seemed to be Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi.
sen.cmt: a envoy→an envoyに修正、conferのスペルミス修正、クォーテーション表記修正、カンマ→セミコロンに変更しました。
sen.e: Ryoshun interned an envoy from Ming who was sent to confer peerage of '日本国王良懐' (King of Japan Ryokai); because 'King of Japan Ryokai' seemed to be Imperial Prince Kaneyoshi.

sen.j: 高麗の使者鄭夢周とも接して独自の交渉を行い、92年に李氏朝鮮が成立しても交渉を継続する。
sen.e: He had connection with 鄭夢周 (Teimushu), a envoy from Goryeo and negotiated with him by his own, after establishment of Joseon Dynasty the negotiation continued.
He had connection with Jeong Mongju, a envoy from Goryeo and negotiated with him by his own, after establishment of the Joseon Dynasty the negotiation continued.
sen.cmt: 鄭夢周 (Teimushu)→Jeong Mongju (参照:http://www.google.co.jp/search?hl=ja&rlz=1T4GGIH_jaJP280JP280&tbs=bks%3A1&q=Jeong+Mongju+%E9%84%AD%E5%A4%A2%E5%91%A8&btnG=%E6%A4%9C%E7%B4%A2&aq=f&aqi=&aql=&oq=&gs_rfai=)、the Joseon Dynastyとしました。
sen.e: He had connection with Jeong Mongju, a envoy from Goryeo and negotiated with him by his own, after establishment of the Joseon Dynasty the negotiation continued.

sen.j: 大内氏にも呼びかけて倭寇(前期倭寇)を鎮圧し、倭寇に拉致された高麗人の送還などを行い、『大蔵経』を求める。
sen.e: He consulted with Ouchi clan and broke down early wako (Japanese pirates), then he sent back people from Goryeo abducted by wako to their homeland and he looked for "Daizokyo-kyo Sutra"(the Tripitaka).

He consulted with the Ouchi clan and broke down early wako (Japanese pirates), then he sent back people from Goryeo abducted by wako to their homeland and he looked for "Daizokyo-kyo Sutra"(the Tripitaka).

He consulted with the Ouchi clan and broke down early wako (Japanese pirates), then he sent back people from Goryeo abducted by wako to their homeland and he looked for "Daizokyo-kyo Sutra"(the Tripitaka).

sen.j: 1395年（応永2年）7月、了俊に上京の命が下り、同年8月に上京した。
sen.e: In July 1395 he was ordered to come to Kyoto and he went to Kyoto in August.
In July 1395 he was ordered to come to Kyoto and he went to Kyoto in September of the same year.
sen.cmt: 旧暦→新暦に修正、of the same year追加しました。
sen.e: In July 1395 he was ordered to come to Kyoto and he went to Kyoto in September of the same year.

sen.j: ところが、上京した了俊は九州探題を罷免されてしまい、後任の九州探題として渋川満頼が任命される。
sen.e: However Ryoshun was removed from Kyushu Tandai position and Mitsuyori SHIBUKAWA became successor of the position.
However Ryoshun was removed from the position of Kyushu Tandai and Mitsuyori SHIBUKAWA became the successor of the position.
sen.cmt: from Kyushu Tandai position→from the position of Kyushu Tandai、successor→the successorとしました。
sen.e: However Ryoshun was removed from the position of Kyushu Tandai and Mitsuyori SHIBUKAWA became the successor of the position.

sen.j: 了俊が解任された理由。
sen.e: The reasons of removal are below.
sen.cmt: 原文変更しました。：了俊が解任された理由として、→了俊が解任された理由。
sen.e: The reasons of removal are as below.
The reasons of removal are as below.

sen.j: 了俊を九州探題に推薦した細川頼之が康暦の政変により失脚し1392年（元中9年/明徳）に死去したため、反細川派の斯波義将が管領となった。
sen.e: At Koryaku Coup Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA fell from power and passed away in 1392, then Yoshimasa SHIBA took over the Kanrei position and balance among the political powers changed and Ryoshun lost his support base.
sen.cmt: 原文文末変更しました。：失っていたこと→失った。
sen.e: At the Koryaku Coup Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA who recommended Ryoshun for the position of Kyushu Tandai fell from power and passed away in 1392, then Yoshimasa SHIBA of the anti-Hosokawa group took over the Kanrei position.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」「了俊を九州探題に推薦した」「反細川派の」→訳漏れのため訳出、the Koryaku Coupとしました。
sen.e: At the Koryaku Coup Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA who recommended Ryoshun for the position of Kyushu Tandai fell from power and passed away in 1392, then Yoshimasa SHIBA of the anti-Hosokawa group took over the Kanrei position.

sen.j: その結果政界構造が変化して支持基盤を失っていた。
sen.e: As a result, balance among the political powers changed and Ryoshun lost his support base.
As a result, balance among the political powers changed and Ryoshun lost his support base.

sen.j: 後任の渋川氏が将軍義満、義将と縁戚関係にあった。
sen.e: Shibukawa clan was related to Shogun Yoshimitsu and Yoshimasa.
sen.cmt: 原文文末変更しました。：あったこと→あった。
sen.e: The Shibukawa clan was related to Shogun Yoshimitsu and Yoshimasa.
The Shibukawa clan was related to Shogun Yoshimitsu and Yoshimasa.

sen.j: 南北朝合一を達成して将軍権力を確立した義満が、了俊の九州における勢力拡大や独自の外交権を危険視していた。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu accomplished the unification of the Northern and Southern Dynasties and gained power of the shogun, but he considered Ryoshun's force and diplomatic right dangerous.
sen.cmt: 原文文末変更しました。：していたこと→していた。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu accomplished the unification of the Northern and Southern Courts and gained power of the shogun, but he considered Ryoshun's force and diplomatic right dangerous.
sen.cmt: Northern and Southern Dynasties→Northern and Southern Courtsに修正しました。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu accomplished the unification of the Northern and Southern Courts and gained power of the shogun, but he considered Ryoshun's force and diplomatic right dangerous.

sen.j: などが指摘されている。
sen.e: Above mentioned reasons are pointed.
Above mentioned reasons are pointed out.
Above mentioned reasons are pointed out.

sen.j: 了俊は九州探題を罷免された後、駿河国(静岡県)半国の守護を命じられ、甥の今川泰範と分割統治することとなった。
sen.e: After he was removed from Kyushu Tandai position, he was ordered to be a shugo for half of Suruga Province and divided the province and ruled with Yasunori IMAGAWA, his nephew.
After he was removed from the position of Kyushu Tandai, he was ordered to be a shugo for half of Suruga Province and divided and ruled the province with Yasunori IMAGAWA, his nephew.
sen.cmt: Kyushu Tandai position→the position of Kyushu Tandai、divided the province and ruled with→divided and ruled the province withとしました。
sen.e: After he was removed from the position of Kyushu Tandai, he was ordered to be a shugo for half of Suruga Province and divided and ruled the province with Yasunori IMAGAWA, his nephew.

sen.j: 後任の探題職を望んでいた大内義弘は大友氏や了俊に対して連合を持ちかけるが、了俊は拒絶。
sen.e: Yoshihiro OUCHI wished to get Tandai shiki position (a governor of Shogunal deputies), so he asked Otomo clan and Ryoshun to cooperate with him, but Ryoshun refused this.
Yoshihiro OUCHI wished to get Tandai shiki position (a governor of Shogunal deputies), so he asked the Otomo clan and Ryoshun to cooperate with him, but Ryoshun refused this.
Yoshihiro OUCHI wished to get Tandai shiki position (a governor of Shogunal deputies), so he asked the Otomo clan and Ryoshun to cooperate with him, but Ryoshun refused this.

sen.j: 守護職としての駿河統治に従事する。
sen.e: Ryoshun served as Shugoshiki and ruled Suruga Province.
Ryoshun served as Shugoshiki and ruled Suruga Province.
Ryoshun served as Shugoshiki and ruled Suruga Province.

sen.j: 1399年（応永6年）、義弘が堺で挙兵し応永の乱が起こる。
sen.e: In 1399, Yoshihiro raised an army in Sakai and Oei War began.
In 1399, Yoshihiro raised an army in Sakai and the Oei War began.
In 1399, Yoshihiro raised an army in Sakai and the Oei War began.

sen.j: 了俊は鎌倉公方の足利満兼（足利氏満の長男）に乱に呼応するように呼びかけたとも言われ、義満に関与を疑われ、平定後の翌年には鎌倉公方を補佐する関東管領の上杉憲定に対して貞世追討令が出される。
sen.e: It was said that Ryoshun asked Mitsukane ASHIKAGA (the first son of Ujimitsu ASHIKAGA) to join the war, so Yoshimitsu suspected Ryoshun's involvement in this incidence, then a year after suppression Norisada UESUGI, Kanto Kanrei (A shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) was ordered to track down and kill Ryoshu.

It was said that Ryoshun asked Mitsukane ASHIKAGA (the first son of Ujimitsu ASHIKAGA) to join the war, so Yoshimitsu suspected Ryoshun's involvement in this incident, then a year after suppression, Norisada UESUGI, Kanto Kanrei (A shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) was ordered to track down and kill Ryoshun.
sen.cmt: カンマ追加、incidence→incident、Ryoshu→Ryoshunに修正しました。
sen.e: It was said that Ryoshun asked Mitsukane ASHIKAGA (the first son of Ujimitsu ASHIKAGA) to join the war, so Yoshimitsu suspected Ryoshun's involvement in this incident, then a year after suppression, Norisada UESUGI, Kanto Kanrei (A shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) was ordered to track down and kill Ryoshun.

sen.j: 了俊は憲定や一族の助命嘆願で許され、1402年に上洛し、政界に関与しないことを条件に赦免された。
sen.e: Because of Norisada and Imagawa clan's plea for sparing a life, Ryoshun was forgiven, and in 1402, he went to Kyoto and was pardoned on condition of not being involved in politics.
Because of Norisada and the Imagawa clan's plea for sparing a life, Ryoshun was forgiven, and in 1402, he went to Kyoto and was pardoned on condition of not being involved in politics.
Because of Norisada and the Imagawa clan's plea for sparing a life, Ryoshun was forgiven, and in 1402, he went to Kyoto and was pardoned on condition of not being involved in politics.

sen.j: 晩年は『難太平記』の執筆など著作活動を行い、96歳前後で死去。
sen.e: In his later years, he wrote "Nantaiheiki"and he passed away around the age of 96.
In his later years, he wrote books such as "Nantaiheiki" and he passed away around the age of 96.
sen.cmt: wrote "Nantaiheiki"→wrote books such as "Nantaiheiki"としました。
sen.e: In his later years, he wrote books such as "Nantaiheiki" and he passed away around the age of 96.

sen.j: 墓所は静岡県袋井市の海蔵寺。
sen.e: There is a graveyard of Ryoshun at Kaizo-ji Temple in Fukuroi City, Shizuoka Prefecture today.
There is a graveyard of Ryoshun at Kaizo-ji Temple in Fukuroi City, Shizuoka Prefecture.
There is a graveyard of Ryoshun at Kaizo-ji Temple in Fukuroi City, Shizuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 和歌は幼少時から祖母の香雲院や京極為基、冷泉為秀らに学び、連歌では二条良基らに学ぶ。
sen.e: From his childhood he studied Waka under Kounin, his grand mother, Tamemoto KYOGOKU and Tamehide REIZEI and studied Renga under Yoshimoto NIJO.
From his childhood he studied waka under Kounin, his grand mother, Tamemoto KYOGOKU and Tamehide REIZEI and studied renga (linked verse) under Yoshimoto NIJO.
sen.cmt: Waka→waka、Renga→rengaとし、rengaの補足追加しました。(用語集参照)
sen.e: From his childhood he studied waka under Kounin, his grand mother, Tamemoto KYOGOKU and Tamehide REIZEI and studied renga (linked verse) under Yoshimoto NIJO.

sen.j: 正徹とも交友。
sen.e: He formed friendship with Shotetsu.
He formed friendship with Shotetsu.
He formed friendship with Shotetsu.

sen.j: 禅や儒学なども行う。
sen.e: He practiced zen and studied Confucianism.
He practiced Zen and studied Confucianism.
He practiced Zen and studied Confucianism.

sen.j: 『言塵集』という歌集や、九州探題としての赴任途中の紀行文『道ゆきぶり』を残す。
sen.e: He left a collection of poetry "Gonjinshu" and writings dealing with travel to Kyushu "Michiyukiburi".
He left a collection of poetry "Gonjinshu" (Ryoshun's Collection of Verbal Dust) and writings dealing with travel to Kyushu "Michiyukiburi."
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を移動、Gonjinshuの補足を追加しました。(参照: http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=BSmMbQhafJoC&pg=PA168&dq=gonjinshu&hl=ja&ei=jd90TIeuNI24vgO4r4ihBg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CC8Q6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=gonjinshu&f=false)
sen.e: He left a collection of poetry "Gonjinshu" (Ryoshun's Collection of Verbal Dust) and writings dealing with travel to Kyushu "Michiyukiburi."

sen.j: 吉田兼好の弟子である命松丸とも親交があり、命松丸が九州下向へ従っている事などから『徒然草』の編纂にも関わっているとも言われるが、否定的研究もある。
sen.e: He had a close relationship with Meishomaru who was a disciple of Kenko YOSHIDA, because Meishomaru went Kyushu with Ryoshun, it was said that Ryoshun was involved into compilation of "Tsurezure gusa", but there are some studies which is opposed to this.

He had a close relationship with Meishomaru who was a disciple of Kenko YOSHIDA, because Meishomaru went Kyushu with Ryoshun, it was said that Ryoshun was involved into compilation of the "Tsurezuregusa" (Essays in Idleness), but there are some studies which are opposed to this.
sen.cmt: the "Tsurezuregusa"とし、補足を追加 (用語集参照)、studies which is→studies which areに修正しました。
sen.e: He had a close relationship with Meishomaru who was a disciple of Kenko YOSHIDA, because Meishomaru went Kyushu with Ryoshun, it was said that Ryoshun was involved into compilation of the "Tsurezuregusa" (Essays in Idleness), but there are some studies which are opposed to this.

sen.j: 晩年には学者として著作に専念し、『難太平記』は古典『太平記』を難ずる意味の歴史書で、応永の乱における自らの立場や、太平記に記されない一族の功績を記している。
sen.e: In the last years, he was concentrated in writing as a scholar, the history book named "Nan-Tahiheiki" was meant to criticize "Taiheiki", so he wrote about his position during Oei War and great achievements made by Imagawa clan which were not written in "Taiheiki".

In the last years, he concentrated on writing as a scholar; the history book named "Nan-Tahiheiki" was meant to criticize the "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace), so he wrote about his position during the Oei War and great achievements made by the Imagawa clan which were not written in the "Taiheiki."
sen.cmt: he was concentrated in→he concentrated onとし、カンマ→セミコロンに変更、the "Taiheiki"とし、補足を追加 (用語集参照)、the Oei War、the Imagawa clanとし、ピリオドの位置を移動しました。
sen.e: In the last years, he concentrated on writing as a scholar; the history book named "Nan-Tahiheiki" was meant to criticize the "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace), so he wrote about his position during the Oei War and great achievements made by the Imagawa clan which were not written in the "Taiheiki."

sen.j: 『道ゆきぶり』
sen.e: "Michiyukiburi"
"Michiyukiburi"
sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去しました。
sen.e: "Michiyukiburi"

sen.j: 『下草』
sen.e: "Shitakusa"
"Shitakusa" (The Grasses Beneath)
sen.cmt: 補足追加しました。（用語集参照)
sen.e: "Shitakusa" (The Grasses Beneath)

sen.j: 『了俊大草子』
sen.e: "Ryoshun Ozoshi"
"Ryoshun Ozoshi"
"Ryoshun Ozoshi"

sen.j: 『難太平記』
sen.e: "Nan-Taiheiki"
"Nan-Taiheiki"
"Nan-Taiheiki"

sen.j: 『二言抄』
sen.e: "Nigonsho"
sen.cmt: 読み方不明です。二言抄
sen.e: "Nigonsho" (A Treatise of Two Words)
sen.cmt: 補足追加しました。(参照: http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=BSmMbQhafJoC&pg=PA168&dq=gonjinshu&hl=ja&ei=jd90TIeuNI24vgO4r4ihBg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CC8Q6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=gonjinshu&f=false)
sen.e: "Nigonsho" (A Treatise of Two Words)

sen.j: 『了俊日記』
sen.e: "Ryoshun Nikki"
"Ryoshun Nikki" (The Diary of Ryoshun)
"Ryoshun Nikki" (The Diary of Ryoshun)

sen.e: "Ryoshun Issiden"
"Ryoshun Isshiden"
"Ryoshun Isshiden"

"Ryoshun Kagakusho" (Ryoshun's Poetics)
